page.title: 14LEOMINSTER RAILWAY STATION
page.content: The station stands a little way out of the town centre on the Worcester Road. During the past three years it has been the focus of a big clean-up operation after an appeal and petition by the people of Leominster. It is now clean and tidy and part occupied by local craftsmen. The station is unmanned and passengers usually pay on the train. Trains from Leominster run direct to Cardiff via Hereford and Newport and to Crewe via Ludlow and Shrewsbury. Connections can be made all over England, Wales and Scotland. The train is also much used locally by shoppers and school children on the fast regular service to Hereford. On occasions we are reminded of a bygone age when one of Bulmer's steam engines roars through our station watched by many enthusiasts.
